attributes.action: Introduce new measures to curtail media reporting on state sensitive events and prevent damaging publication of stories covering high profile figures such as Sir Ian Blair etc.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
All too often the media in the UK, not least the BBC, have released stories about senior figures and global events as much as domestic that have had an effect of immesurably damaging the roles of such figures. Creating media focus that are not in the public interest and have lead to ongoing national security endeavours being compromised.

Yes, the media have a duty to inform the public of newsworthy information but that should not include charecter and organisational assassination which is tantamount to subversion of the state.

We live in different times in the 21st century and sensitive matters of state and security should be afforded greater protections from the foolhardy reporting by media elements.

Who is with me?
